article_title: Tuesday letters: Louisiana politics, minimum wage, heart treatment
article_text: To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com.

article_metadata.description: [...] even if minimum wage were increased, the added costs for all goods and services for everyone would render that raise meaningless.  Regarding "Stages' actress has fun being a nun" (Page G2, Sunday), as longtime participants in Rosenberg's Cast Theater (acting, box officing, fundraising, board membering) we saw the Diana Vreeland play and have returned to see Denise Fennellin "Sister's Christmas Catechism."  Regarding "Republican Cassidy continues GOP rout with win over Landrieu in Louisiana race" (Page A2, Sunday), in the article about Sen. Mary Landrieu's loss to Rep. Bill Cassidy in a runoff election held in Louisiana, the report calls Cassidy a "lackluster opponent who largely ducked public appearances."  [...] I saw Cassidy on Fox News and found him to be very articulate and dynamic.  [...] he was widely expected to win this election hands-down.  [...] Mary Landrieu was a key supporter of the disastrous Obamacare law.
article_metadata.author.name: Copyright 2014: Houston Chronicle
